item.title: Eight rules for writing fiction (Kurt Vonnegut)
item.description: George Orwell had five rules for better writing. Vonnegut has eight! EIGHT!
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: advice writing

item.title: CSS+Javascript power. Fancy menu
item.description: A nice example of a fancy menu that uses JavaScript to add sparkle to a plain old HTML list in a fashion that does not require contorted HTML in your document.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: animation css html javascript pretty programming tutorial

item.title: Granby (FontShop)
item.description: A sanserif typeface designed in metal in the 1930s as a competitor to Gill Sans but actually closer to the original Johnston Underground font. Five weights, but no italics.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: font sanserif wishlist

item.title: Five simple steps to better typography (Mark Boulton)
item.description: Some fundamental typographical conventions translated in to HTML+CSS.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: blog-entry css html layout tutorial typography

item.title: Web Typography Sucks (Slides and notes from SxSW 2007)
item.description: Many of the conventions of traditional typography are forgotten or ignored by people creating web pages. This slide show from SXSW discusses some points of typography and how to achive them in HTML+CSS.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: css html presentation typography web

item.title: Mark Simonson Studio / Notebook
item.description: Weblog of s type designer. ‘I have frequently done lettering as part of design projects I'm working on. This has always been my favorite part, so in 2000 I opened my own shop specializing in lettering, typography and identity design.’
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: blog design graphics lettering type-design typography weblog

item.title: Metallophile Sp 8 Family by Mark Simonson Studio (Font Bros)
item.description: A faithful facsimile of an 8-point sans serif typeface as set on a 1940s-vintage hot metal typesetting machine.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: font futura hot-metal sanserif wishlist

item.title: Proxima Nova (Mark Simonson's web site)
item.description: A sanserif font that I like the look of, combining geomertic and humanist influences, it looks clean and ultra-modern.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: font sanserif typography wishlist

item.title: Proxima Nova Complete OT
item.description: Mark Simonson's clean and elegant sanserif is a geometric-humanist blend.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: font wishlist

item.title: Support @font-face (Mozilla Bug 70132)
item.description: Discussion of whether and how to add embeddable fonts to Mozilla Firefox.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: bugzilla firefox font-embedding fonts futile mozilla typography

item.title: Embedded fonts in Netscape Navigator 4 (Webmonkey)
item.description: Ancient scrolls describe how Bitstream and Netscape joined forces to make a system for embedding fonts in web pages to parallel Microsoft's TrueType-based WEFT system.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: bitstream font-embedding fonts netscape past typography

item.title: Microsoft WEFT 3 (web font-embedding tool)
item.description: Microsoft's program for creating embedded fonts tailored to your web pages. (Windows only, and the embedded fonts work in MSIE only.)
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: css embed font-embedding font-face fonts microsoft msie typography weft

item.title: Font Embedding in MSIE4
item.description: In 1997, embedding special compressed, subsetted fonts in your web pages was all the rage. This is Microsoft's version of the idea, using the @font-face CSS rule and a program called WEFT.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: 1990s css css2 font-embedding font-face fonts forgotten-html html microsoft msie typography web

item.title: Universal Feed Parser
item.description: Mark Pilgrim’s parse-at-all-costs reader for RSS and Atom feeds in Python. 3000 unit tests. Open source.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: atom library parser python rss syndication xml

item.title: Underware
item.description: A graphic design studio which specializes in designing and producing typefaces (e.g., Fakir, a blackletter, and Auto, a sanserif with 3 italics). Based in Den Haag, Helsinki and Amsterdam.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: design fonts type-design typography

item.title: Is Not Magazine
item.description: A magazine in the form of a 1.5m x 2m bill poster. It is the work of five young Melburnians, and from April 9, 2005, it has been on display at 50 outdoor poster sites in inner-city Melbourne.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: 2d design magazine printing typography vllg.com zine

item.title: mezzoblue (Dave Shea's weblog)
item.description: "I’m a Vancouver local and a freelance designer. I’m happiest when designing, building, or creating something that didn’t previously exist; this has taken many forms over the years."
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: 2d blog css design mezzoblue typography weblog

item.title: Icon Design: Sizing (mezzoblue)
item.description: Using vectors does not solve all your resizing problems: you need to tweak the small-scale versions to avoid fuzzy anti-aliasing. Similar issues to font-hinting at small sizes.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: 2d blog-entry design graphics mezzoblue vector

item.title: The Macalope (weblog)
item.description: Born of the earth, forged in fire, the Macalope was branded by the IT world “non-standard” and “proprietary.” A freak of nature. Part man, part Mac, part antelope, the Macalope set forth on a quest to save his beloved platform.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: apple blog mac weblog

item.title: Genshi: Generate Content for the Web
item.description: A Python library that provides components for parsing, generating and filtering HTML, XML and text content for output on the web. Includes a template language heavily inspired by Kid.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: genshi html kid templating xml

item.title: splinter (matthew.kroeker industrial design)
item.description: Two chairs join neatly along a jagged line of displaed wooden slats to form a small bench.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: chair design furniture

item.title: How FairPlay Works: Apple's iTunes DRM Dilemma
item.description: Pretty good summary of how Apple's DRM system works, and why the 'simple' changes outsiders have suggested (such as licensing to third parties, or selling non-DRM tunes alongside encumbered ones) would not be simple or even feasible.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: apple drm fairplay ipod itunes

item.title: Fakir (village /// vllg.com)
item.description: A modern font based on broad-nibbed blackletter forms, but then reverse-engineered in to a normal-weight font with a curious, twisty, broken-line character.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: blackletter font wishlist

item.title: Kaas (village /// vllg.com)
item.description: Amazingly chunky font based on traditional Germanic blackletter (Fraktur, Textura).
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: font wishlist

item.title: Lux Sans (village /// vllg.com)
item.description: A sanserif font family with all the OpenType stuff and an amusing treatment of the top of the counter of D, P, B, and friends.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: font vllg.com wishlish

item.title: Study sees harmful hunt for extra oil (FT.com / In depth)
item.description: A stark prediciton of future energy shortages. The transition to expensive and polluting reliance on 'unconventional oil' (like Canadian tar sands) could come sooner than most oil analysts had expected.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: carbon energy future oil politics via:reddit.com

item.title: Garrett Dimon’s weblog
item.description: Blog of yet another web designer with an emphasis on simple, clean, and vivid typographical presnetation.
item.dc:creator: pdc
item.dc:subject: blog design typography usability weblog

item.title: REST and WS-* (Joe Gregorio | BitWorking)
item.description: Outlines how WS-* and REST are appropriate at different levels of scalability, and how to go about designing a REST protocol.

item.title: Atom Publishing Protocol project page (Joe Gregorio)

item.title: Getting the msut out of your laptop battery
item.description: Tips for calibrating PowerBook and MacBook batteries, and monitoring their effectiveness.

item.dc:subject: advice battery blog-entry hardware powerbook tip

item.title: GridAccelerators-Whitepaper.pdf (application/pdf Object)
item.description: How Joyent's acellerators-by-the-yard system can make deploying your massive web application less of a hassle.
